issue_comments.body:
I don't think it would be possible for the website itself to do that, as php wouldn't work (there's no server, so it must be client-side javascript).

Maybe providing a script (shell script and such) you would run BEFORE uploading would be better.
It could use ffmpeg, and create multiple video files on different qualities. 

Then, it would be a matter of allowing the website to accept these multiple files.

I also know about this project https://bgrins.github.io/videoconverter.js , but don't know how efficient it would be.
One thing you can do at the moment is to copy the html5 link for the video on kopykate, and paste it on a <video> html tag on your website.
